## 1C: GO Enrichment Analysis (EnrichR)

### Run EnrichR per cluster

```{r}
# Required Libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(cowplot)
library(stringr)  # To wrap text
library(enrichR)  # Assuming enrichR is used for enrichment analysis

# Get top 30 significant genes per cluster
top_genes_per_cluster <- scran_markers[logFC > 0, head(.SD, 250), by = cluster, .SDcols = "feats"]

# Define Enrichr libraries of interest
enrichr_libraries <- c("GO_Biological_Process_2023")

# Initialize a list to store enrichment results
enrichment_results <- list()

# Loop over each cluster and perform enrichment
for (cluster_id in unique(top_genes_per_cluster$cluster)) {
  
  # Extract the top 30 gene list for the current cluster
  gene_list <- top_genes_per_cluster[cluster == cluster_id, feats]
  
  # Perform enrichment analysis using Enrichr
  result <- enrichr(genes = gene_list, databases = enrichr_libraries)
  
  # Store the result for the cluster
  enrichment_results[[cluster_id]] <- result
  
  # Print a message to indicate completion of each cluster
  cat("Completed enrichment analysis for cluster:", cluster_id, "\n")
}

```

### Plot GO Biological Process enrichment bars

```{r}
# Modified Gene Enrichment Plot Function with improved text readability
# Added text shadow/halo effect for better contrast on colored bars

# Helper function to add text with shadow/halo for better readability
geom_text_with_shadow <- function(mapping = NULL, data = NULL, stat = "identity",
                                   position = "identity", ..., 
                                   shadow_color = "black", shadow_offset = 0.3) {
  list(
    # Shadow layer (slightly offset dark text behind)
    geom_text(mapping = mapping, data = data, stat = stat, position = position,
              color = shadow_color, nudge_x = shadow_offset, nudge_y = -shadow_offset, ...),
    # Main text layer
    geom_text(mapping = mapping, data = data, stat = stat, position = position, ...)
  )
}

custom_plotEnrich <- function(cluster_result, cluster_id, is_last = FALSE) {
  
  # Extract count from Overlap column (assuming format like "5/200")
  cluster_result$Count <- as.numeric(sapply(strsplit(cluster_result$Overlap, "/"), `[`, 1))
  
  # Take top 5 terms ordered by P.value
  cluster_result <- head(cluster_result[order(cluster_result$P.value), ], 5)
  
  # Keep full term names
  cluster_result$Term_wrapped <- cluster_result$Term
  
  # Calculate font size for each term - reduce only for long terms (increased sizes)
  cluster_result$font_size <- ifelse(
    nchar(cluster_result$Term) > 70, 5.0,
    ifelse(nchar(cluster_result$Term) > 55, 5.8, 6.5)
  )
  
  # Calculate the maximum bar width for proper spacing
  max_count <- max(cluster_result$Count, na.rm = TRUE)
  
  # Extend x-axis to fit long text labels
  max_term_length <- max(nchar(cluster_result$Term))
  x_extension <- ifelse(max_term_length > 60, 2.0, ifelse(max_term_length > 45, 1.5, 1.3))
  
  # Create the plot with improved text readability
  p <- ggplot(cluster_result, aes(x = Count, y = reorder(Term, -P.value))) +
    # Add colored bars
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", aes(fill = P.value), width = 0.85) +
    # Add semi-transparent white background box behind text for readability
    # Use x = 0 with hjust = 0 for consistent left alignment across all clusters
    geom_label(aes(x = 0, label = Term_wrapped, size = font_size), 
               hjust = 0,
               color = "grey10",
               fontface = "bold",
               fill = alpha("white", 0.75),
               label.padding = unit(0.35, "lines"),
               label.r = unit(0.15, "lines"),  # Rounded corners
               linewidth = 0,  # No border
               position = position_nudge(x = 0.1, y = 0)) +
    scale_size_identity() +  # Use the calculated font sizes directly
    # Set proper plot limits - extended to fit text
    scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, max_count * x_extension), 
                       expand = c(0, 0)) +
    # Color scale for P-values: smaller p-values as red, larger as blue
    # Use consistent scientific notation with superscript for legend labels
    scale_fill_gradient(low = "#D73027", high = "#4575B4", 
                        name = "P-value",
                        breaks = function(x) seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = 4),
                        labels = function(x) {
                          sapply(x, function(val) {
                            if (val == 0) return("0")
                            exp_val <- floor(log10(val))
                            mantissa <- val / 10^exp_val
                            # Format as "N×10⁻ˣ" with superscript
                            paste0(format(round(mantissa, 1), nsmall = 1), "×10", 
                                   ifelse(exp_val < 0, "⁻", ""), 
                                   # Convert digits to superscript
                                   gsub("0", "⁰", gsub("1", "¹", gsub("2", "²", gsub("3", "³", 
                                   gsub("4", "⁴", gsub("5", "⁵", gsub("6", "⁶", gsub("7", "⁷",
                                   gsub("8", "⁸", gsub("9", "⁹", as.character(abs(exp_val)))))))))))))
                          })
                        },
                        guide = guide_colorbar(barwidth = 2, barheight = 10, nbin = 100)) + 
    labs(title = paste("Cluster", cluster_id),
         x = if(is_last) "Gene Count" else NULL) +
    theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
    theme(
      axis.text.y = element_blank(),
      axis.title.y = element_blank(),
      axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
      panel.grid.major.y = element_blank(),
      panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
      plot.title = element_text(size = 22, face = "bold", hjust = 0),
      axis.text.x = element_text(size = 18, color = "grey20"),
      axis.title.x = element_text(size = 26, face = "bold"),
      legend.position = "right",
      legend.justification = c(0, 1),  # Align legends at top-left of legend box
      legend.key.size = unit(2, "lines"),
      legend.text = element_text(size = 14),
      legend.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
      legend.box.margin = margin(0, 0, 0, 0),
      plot.margin = margin(10, 15, 10, 10)
    )
  
  return(p)
}

# Create plots with error handling
plots <- list()
cluster_names <- names(enrichment_results)
for (i in seq_along(cluster_names)) {
  cluster_id <- cluster_names[i]
  cluster_result <- enrichment_results[[cluster_id]][["GO_Biological_Process_2023"]]
  is_last <- (i == length(cluster_names))
  plot <- tryCatch({
    custom_plotEnrich(cluster_result, cluster_id, is_last = is_last)
  }, error = function(e) {
    message(sprintf("Error in cluster %s: %s", cluster_id, e$message))
    return(NULL)
  })
  
  if (!is.null(plot)) {
    plots[[cluster_id]] <- plot
  }
}

# Remove NULL entries
plots <- plots[!sapply(plots, is.null)]

# Only create combined plot if we have plots to combine
# Create combined plot if we have plots to combine
if (length(plots) > 0) {
  # Combine plots
  GOBiologicalProcess_combined <- plot_grid(
    plotlist = plots, 
    ncol = 1,
    align = 'v',
    axis = 'l'
  )
  
  # Add the title to the combined plot
  GOBiologicalProcess_combined <- plot_grid(
    ggdraw() + 
      draw_label(
        "Top 5 GO Biological Process Enrichment", 
        fontface = 'bold', 
        size = 30,   # Adjust the size of the title
        hjust = 0.5  # Center the title horizontally
      ),
    GOBiologicalProcess_combined,
    ncol = 1, 
    rel_heights = c(0.04, 1)  # Reduced title height
  )

  # Save the plot with the title - increased DPI for publication
  ggsave(
    filename = "./figures/GOBiologicalProcess_combined.png",
    plot = GOBiologicalProcess_combined,
    width = 16, 
    height = 5 * length(plots) + 1.5,  # Adjust height based on number of plots
    dpi = 600,
    bg = "white"  # Ensure white background
  )
  
  # Display the combined plot with title (optional)
  print(GOBiologicalProcess_combined)
} else {
  message("No valid plots were created. Please check your enrichment results.")
}
# Display the adjusted plot (optional)
print(GOBiologicalProcess_combined)
```

### Save enrichment results (Supplementary Table S2)

```{r}
# Initialize an empty list to store flattened results
flattened_results <- list()

# Loop over each cluster and flatten the enrichment results
for (cluster_id in names(enrichment_results)) {
  if (!is.null(enrichment_results[[cluster_id]][["GO_Biological_Process_2023"]])) {
    cluster_data <- enrichment_results[[cluster_id]][["GO_Biological_Process_2023"]]
    cluster_data$Cluster <- cluster_id  # Add cluster ID as a new column
    
    # Concatenate gene names into a single string
    cluster_data$Genes <- sapply(cluster_data$Genes, function(genes) {
      paste(genes, collapse = ", ")
    })
    
    flattened_results[[cluster_id]] <- cluster_data
  }
}

# Combine all cluster results into a single data frame
combined_results <- do.call(rbind, flattened_results)

# Define the file path for saving
enrichment_results_file <- file.path(supplementary_figures, "Supplementary Table S2.csv")

# Save the combined results as a CSV file
fwrite(
  combined_results,
  file = enrichment_results_file
)

# Confirmation message
message("Enrichment results saved to: ", enrichment_results_file)
```

# FIGURE 2: Top Marker Gene Spatial Expression (DMSO)

## Helper function: spatial feature plot workaround

```{r}
# Custom wrapper for spatInSituPlotPoints to plot expression per feature
spatinsitu_feat_workaround <- function(
        gobject, feat, 
        expression_values = "scaled", 
        spat_unit = NULL, 
        feat_type = NULL, 
        ...) {
    expr_table <- spatValues(gobject,
                             spat_unit = spat_unit, 
                             feat_type = feat_type,
                             expression_values = expression_values,
                             feats = feat)
    gobject <- addCellMetadata(gobject,
                               spat_unit = spat_unit,
                               feat_type = feat_type,
                               new_metadata = expr_table,
                               by_column = TRUE)
    p <- list(
        gobject = gobject,
        polygon_fill = feat,
        ...
    )
    do.call(spatInSituPlotPoints, p)
}
```

```{r}
# Required Libraries

# Generate plots for each gene

  gene_plot <- spatinsitu_feat_workaround(

      show_image = TRUE, 
      image_name = "image",

      save_plot = FALSE,
      polygon_alpha = 0.7,
      polygon_line_size = 0.1,
      polygon_color = "#333030",
      background_color = "white", 
      xlim = c(13600, 22000), 
      ylim = c(-17200, -13800)
  ) +
    ggplot2::theme_classic() +
    ggplot2::theme(
      axis.line = ggplot2::element_line(color = "black", linewidth = 0.8),

      axis.title.y = ggplot2::element_text(size = 14),

      x = "x coordinates",
      y = "y coordinates",
      title = gene  # Use the current gene name as the title

    ggplot2::annotate(
      "segment",
      x = x_right,
      xend = x_right + scale_bar_length_pixels,
      y = y_bottom + 250,
      yend = y_bottom + 250,
      color = "black",
      linewidth = 0.8,
      lineend = "round"
    ) +
    ggplot2::annotate(
      "text",
      x = x_right + scale_bar_length_pixels / 2,
      y = y_bottom - 20,

    dpi = 600
  )
```

## 4B: Violin plots - expression comparison with scran p-values

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)
library(Giotto)

# Extract expression data from the Giotto object
expr_matrix <- getExpression(SpatialTrans_combined_ONTgene, values = "normalized", output = "matrix")

# Get cell metadata to identify condition (DMSO vs NUC7738)
cell_meta <- pDataDT(SpatialTrans_combined_ONTgene)

# Identify which cells belong to DMSO vs NUC7738 based on list_ID or other metadata
cell_meta$condition <- ifelse(grepl("DMSO|dmso", cell_meta$list_ID, ignore.case = TRUE), "DMSO", "NUC-7738")

# Create a data frame for violin plots with condition (using all 6 genes from 'genes' variable)
violin_data <- data.frame()
for (gene in genes) {
  if (gene %in% rownames(expr_matrix)) {
    gene_expr <- as.numeric(expr_matrix[gene, ])
    temp_df <- data.frame(
      gene = gene,
      expression = gene_expr,
      cell_id = colnames(expr_matrix),
      condition = cell_meta$condition
    )
    violin_data <- rbind(violin_data, temp_df)
  }
}

# Set gene and condition as factors (maintain order from genes variable)
violin_data$gene <- factor(violin_data$gene, levels = genes)
violin_data$condition <- factor(violin_data$condition, levels = c("DMSO", "NUC-7738"))

# Function to get significance stars
get_stars <- function(p) {
  if (is.na(p)) return("")
  if (p < 1e-5) return("***")
  else if (p < 1e-3) return("**")
  else if (p < 0.05) return("*")
  else return("ns")
}

# Create individual violin plots for each gene (DMSO vs NUC7738)
violin_plot_list <- lapply(seq_along(genes), function(i) {
  gene <- genes[i]
  gene_data <- violin_data[violin_data$gene == gene, ]
  
  # Get max expression for positioning the significance bar
  max_expr <- max(gene_data$expression, na.rm = TRUE)
  
  # Get p-value from scran_results dataframe
  p_val <- scran_results[feats == gene, p.value][1]
  stars <- get_stars(p_val)
  
  p <- ggplot(gene_data, aes(x = condition, y = expression, fill = condition)) +
    geom_violin(trim = FALSE, alpha = 0.7, scale = "width") +
    geom_jitter(width = 0.15, size = 0.3, alpha = 0.3) +
    geom_boxplot(width = 0.15, fill = "white", outlier.shape = NA, alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("DMSO" = "#377EB8", "NUC-7738" = "#FF7F00")) +
    # Add significance bar (positioned higher above plots)
    annotate("segment", x = 1, xend = 2, y = max_expr * 1.20, yend = max_expr * 1.20, linewidth = 0.5) +
    annotate("segment", x = 1, xend = 1, y = max_expr * 1.15, yend = max_expr * 1.20, linewidth = 0.5) +
    annotate("segment", x = 2, xend = 2, y = max_expr * 1.15, yend = max_expr * 1.20, linewidth = 0.5) +
    annotate("text", x = 1.5, y = max_expr * 1.26, label = stars, size = 3, fontface = "bold") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0.05, 0.32))) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
      axis.line = element_line(color = "black", linewidth = 0.8),
      axis.title.x = element_blank(),
      axis.title.y = element_text(size = 10, face = "bold"),
      axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
      axis.text.y = element_text(size = 6),
      legend.position = "none",
      plot.margin = margin(2, 2, 2, 2)
    ) +
    labs(y = "Norm. Expr.")
  
  return(p)
})

# Name the list
names(violin_plot_list) <- genes

# Combine violin plots into one column (6 rows)
violin_plots_combined <- wrap_plots(violin_plot_list, ncol = 1)

# Display violin plots (not saving intermediate)
print(violin_plots_combined)
```
